front.title: Mobile Node Agnostic Fast Handovers for Proxy Mobile IPv6

abstract.t: Proxy Mobile IPv6 (PMIPv6) is a mobile node agnostic mobility management protocol, that is, a mobile node does not implement any mobility management protocol. This document proposes an enhancement to PMIPv6 protocol in order to improve layer 3 handover performance and to transfer context borrowing some ideas from Fast Handovers for Mobile IPv6 (FMIPv6) protocol. In predictive mode, the previous mobile access gateway (PMAG) transfers context to the next MAG (NMAG) using Handover Indication (HI) message, while in reactive mode, NMAG uses Fast Binding Update (FBU) to request context from PMAG. A bi- directional tunnel is established between PMAG and NMAG to transfer packets during handover.
